distribution: Endemic to the northern end of Lake Tanganyika.
habitat: It inhabits areas of shallow water with sandy substrates.
maintenance: Set up the aquarium with large piles of rocks arranged to form caves, large areas of open water for swimming and a sandy substrate, as this species tends to sift through the substrate looking for food.
diet: L. perspicax will accept most foods offered but live and frozen varieties should form the bulk of the diet.
behaviour: Very peaceful. Do not keep with boisterous species such as Mbuna. Good tankmates include Julidochromis, Neolamprologus and Xenotilapia species.
reproduction: Not achieved in aquaria but is known to be a maternal mouthbrooder in nature.
